Events that occurred on 22 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 79.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to John Roberts.
1963 - Linguist and translator Édouard Kloczko born.
1971 - Actor Richard Armitage born.
1980 - Voice actor Norman Shelley dies.
1985 - The Lays of Beleriand is published in the UK.
1992 - Tolkien Centenary Conference, a combination of Oxonmoot 1992 and Mythcon 23, at Keble College, Oxford.
2006 - The Oxford Tolkien Conference at Exeter College, Oxford.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
The escort arrives at Isengard; at sunset[1] King Elessar grants Isengard to the Ents and receives the keys of Orthanc.
Aragorn, Gimli and Legolas say their good-byes to Gandalf and the four Hobbits.
The Fellowship of the Ring is formally disbanded.
Legolas and Gimli set out for their own lands through Fangorn Forest.

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
